qas.question: What does the abbreviation PR stand for in terms of the US military?
What is the definition of a Personnel Recovery mission?

answers.text: military, diplomatic, and civil efforts to prepare for and execute the recovery and reintegration of isolated personnel

qas.question: What is one of the ways that PR uses its capabilities in a crisis?

answers.text: deny an adversary's ability to exploit a nation through propaganda

qas.question: What are the types of international duties of the PR mission?

context: <a0_0>Personnel Recovery<a0_0/> (PR) is defined as "the sum of <a1_0>military, diplomatic, and civil efforts to prepare for and execute the recovery and reintegration of isolated personnel<a1_0/>" (JP 1-02). It is the ability of the US government and its international partners to effect the recovery of isolated personnel across the ROMO and return those personnel to duty. PR also enhances the development of an effective, global capacity to protect and recover isolated personnel wherever they are placed at risk; <a2_0>deny an adversary's ability to exploit a nation through propaganda<a2_0/>; and develop joint, interagency, and international capabilities that contribute to <a3_0>crisis response and regional stability<a3_0/>.
